location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.288 of 1851 from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter in which Hennell writes that the Bushire civil surgeon, James McAlister, thinks he (Hennell) should quit the Persian Gulf in order to improve the state of his health. Hennell writes for guidance from the Government of Bombay, requesting that arrangements be made for him to take the next steamer to the Euphrates.
